meanings.definition: A disease characterized by inflammation of the spinal cord.
meanings.sent1: Myelites can cause pain and weakness in the back.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient with myelites after examining the spinal cord.
meanings.sent3: When myelites strikes, it's like a storm raging in the spine.
meanings.sent4: The inflammation in myelites is like a wildfire spreading through the spinal cord.
meanings.sent5: The inflammation in myelites feels like tiny needles poking the spine.

meanings.definition: A group of cells in the central nervous system that produce myelin.
meanings.sent1: Myelites play a crucial role in protecting nerve fibers.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are studying how myelites contribute to nerve function.
meanings.sent3: The myelites in the nervous system work like tiny guardians of the nerves.
meanings.sent4: The myelites are like builders constructing a protective shield around nerves.
meanings.sent5: The myelites wrap nerves in a cozy blanket of protection.

meanings.definition: A type of white blood cell involved in the immune response.
meanings.sent1: During an infection, myelites rush to fight off harmful invaders.
meanings.sent2: Doctors monitor the levels of myelites to assess immune system health.
meanings.sent3: The myelites in the immune system are like soldiers ready to defend the body.
meanings.sent4: Myelites act as the frontline warriors in the battle against infections.
meanings.sent5: The myelites stand guard, ready to protect the body from harm.
